channel.title: System cannot find the path specified
channel.description:
when i compile it says system cannot find the path specified.
i followed the how to make a server tut
this is my compiler code: [code]@echo off cd Source "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_00\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./*java pause[/code]
any suggestions?

item.title: System cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @Kenpachi_Urasai Kenpachi Urasai
item.description:
@Kenpachi_Urasai wrote:

no actually its not for my comp at least and i have vista i had to change all the jdk6_0_12 to just jdk do that in your compiler, run, and enviroment variables and it should work
and if that doesn’t work look into your program files, find Java, open it and look for a file with Jdk in the name and replace all the stuff i just mentioned to the name of that folder

Read full topic
item.source: System cannot find the path specified

item.title: System cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @njr99 njr99
item.description:
@njr99 wrote:

if i have jfk 6 update 12 what would that be? jdk6.0.12?

Read full topic
item.source: System cannot find the path specified

item.title: System cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Change the path in the batch file to your jdk version, or you can just compile with javac if you’ve correctly set your environmental variables.

Read full topic
item.source: System cannot find the path specified

item.title: System cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @njr99 njr99
item.description:
@njr99 wrote:

ok, thank you[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 19, 2009, 11:33:26 am[/size][hr]i changed some stuff…this is what i have

Compiler:

@echo off cd Source "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./*java pause

my problem is “the sytem cannot find the path specified”

my CLASSPATH is:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

My PATH is:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

Read full topic
item.source: System cannot find the path specified

item.title: System cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @njr99 njr99
item.description:
@njr99 wrote:

now i changed my compiler code to:

@echo off title Compiler javac *.java pause

and i get:
‘javac’ is not reconized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file

BTW, when i tryed to re install jdk it failed[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 19, 2009, 11:11:14 am[/size][hr]wait…now it said (when i open wierd named file)
windows cannot open this file…then prompts me to pick a program to open with

Read full topic

item.title: System cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

njr, go to the java updates download page, download update 11/12
and on ur desktop there shuld b a new file with a weird name, try to open that file, shuld open a java installer thing, just install it and then try 2 compile

it told me that i dont have java…im re downloading

item.source: System cannot find the path specified

item.title: System cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

try this

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic
item.source: System cannot find the path specified

item.title: System cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @njr99 njr99
item.description:
@njr99 wrote:

JDK 6 update 12

i changed my compiler to:

@echo off title compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe" ./files/*.java pause

and my Path in sytem enviromentals to:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk6.0.12\bin;
